Player for nearly 20 minutes, using his quickness to prevent Allen Iverson from even getting the ball, let alone shoot it. He had spent the last two practices impersonating Allen Iverson and apparently got pretty good at it. The animation shows Google's CEO testifying before Congress using real-life, creepy quotes from Eric Schmidt about privacy to make the case for why Congress should question him. http://www.consumerwatchdog.org/video/mr-schmidt-goes-washington. We are using Mr. Eric Schmidt 's own words in this satire to dramatize how outrageous. it is that Congress has failed to question one of the most powerful CEOs in America after he has shown such disregard for our personal privacy and his company has committed the largest wire-tapping breach in history, said Jamie Court , president of Consumer Watchdog.`` Mr. Eric Schmidt '' is a sequel to Consumer Watchdog's first`` Don't Be Evil?'' animation- view it at http://www.consumerwatchdog.org/blog/schmidt-out-googles-ceo-office-privacy- which
